hotspots.label: Great Egret
hotspots.fact: This white bird is called a Great Egret and is a type of heron that hunts for fish in water. Egrets have long, thin legs that help them wade through shallow water without getting stuck in the mud.

hotspots.label: Grazing Cow
hotspots.fact: Cows are herbivores that spend most of their day eating grass in pastures like this one. A single cow can eat up to 40 pounds of grass each day to get the energy and nutrients it needs!

hotspots.label: Pasture Grass
hotspots.fact: This green grass is food for farm animals like cows and sheep. Grass is a plant that grows from the ground and uses sunlight, water, and soil nutrients to grow strong and healthy.

hotspots.label: Forest Habitat
hotspots.fact: The thick forest in the background is a habitat where many animals live, including birds, deer, and insects. Forests provide food, shelter, and protection for wildlife that cannot live in open farm areas.
